WRITING.TEXT: Alba confessing that she wanted Xo to have an abortion is still one of the most jaw-dropping secrets, but this confession comes pretty close in my book. It's just been such a major part of the series that it will be interesting to see how it'll effect Jane's future decisions when it comes to sex!
Is iZombie good? I tried to watch the pilot, but I never finished it.

I agree. The promise Jane made to Alba was really affecting Jane. Almost every time Jane decides to sleep with someone, Alba somehow comes up (Michael, Jonathan). It was her go-to excuse, so it'll be interesting to see how she reacts to making the decision to have sex.

I remember being very young and getting so confused watching "The Color of Friendship" on Disney. At the time, I could not wrap my head around the fact that white girl was from South Africa. It was the first time I can remember thinking about the world on such a large scale and that realizing that stereotypes are not always correct.

Yeah, that's what I'm confused about too.
In the middle of the episode, the police say that Elena (Mutter) is Clara/Rose (Sin Rostro)'s step mother. But then at the end, Rose calls Elena "Mom".
Do step children typically call their step parents "Mom/Dad"? I don't know. Hopefully we'll find out next week.

I refuse to give up hope for Petra/Rafael 2.0.
I'll be the first to admit that Rafael and Petra's marriage was a disaster due to the circumstances. How and why they got together, the miscarriage, Jane's pregnancy, and their respective crazy families. But I feel like there are just way too many instances where the audience is shown that underneath allllll of those situations, that they really do care and love each other.

Rogelio could not catch a break this episode. I mean, he:
-unknowingly lets Mateo eat the diamond
-get chews out by Jane for letting Mateo eat a diamond
-plans Xo's lavish birthday party which she doesn't go to
-has his beautiful proposal derailed and his entire relationship with Xo is thrown into question
What ships did you have going?
Petra looks so happy in them!
A long time ago in Chapter 18 when Elena and Rafael met after 20+ years, she mentioned that to him. I think I remember reading something here that they had cast someone to play that role.
I would *die* if I accidentally read out my advisor's name in my romance short story. I feel embarrassed just watching that scene.

Emilio marries Mia and they have Luisa. Mia dies. Then Emilio marries Elena (Mutter) and they have Rafael. Elena takes the $10 million and divorces Emilio. Elena then gets remarried to someone who already has a daughter, Clara/Rose/Sin Rostro, and also [Future Spoiler?](/s "she has a son with this new husband, thereby giving Rafael a half-brother"). Later Rose has an affair with Luisa and also marries Emilio until his death/murder. So Rose essentially marries and murders her step mother's ex-husband and also has an affair with step mother's ex-husband's daughter. Which means that Mutter is Sin Rostro's step mother.
I'm confused just reading what I wrote.
Edit: Well, crap. Now I'm not sure if the police were incorrect in saying that Clara/Rose/Sin Rostro is Elena's *step* daughter or if Elena really is Rose's actual mother.
I love how Rogelio keeps getting his team's names wrong, but he genuinely believes that he is saying them accurately.
Yeah, "Lusty Virgin" is not her shade.
Right? I thought he was going to snip Mateo's finger off with those.
I'm game.

I met my best friend in kindergarten. I still think to this day that she hypnotized me to be her best friend because she was a mean and rude kid. When we were in 3rd grade, I went over to her house to play. Her family had just gotten a new refrigerator, so we get the idea to make a clubhouse out of the large box.
Now this bitch has me design and create the entire clubhouse. There were windows and pillows inside and I rigged a flashlight to hang like a chandelier in the clubhouse which took me for-fucking-ever. I spent *hours* on this damn clubhouse and it looked awesome.
But after alllllll my hardwork which I did by my damn self, my bitch of a best friend doesn't let me into the clubhouse. I have to sit outside and watch her play in it.
It's almost 15 years later and I'm still pissed about it.

And a lot of people don't. Jane the Virgin has a lot of things working against it. It's on the CW, it's based on a telenovela, and it can be political with their diverse story lines.
But that's some of the main reasons I love the show. It's not going to be everyone's cup of tea, and that's okay.

At the start of the show, Jane is around 23 years old and they had their first kiss 5 years before, not 8 years. So Jane would have been 18 or 19 and Rafael would be around 26 or 27. Still kinda weird to me, but a lot less creepy than a 23 year old kissing a 15 year old!

Both of them actually won a golden globe! Gina Rodriguez (Jane the Virgin) was the first to win one for the CW for Best Performance by an Actress in a Television Series Comedy or Musical. And then Rachel Bloom (Crazy Ex-Girlfriend) won in the same category the next year.
